Sentencas: The oxygen reduction reaction (ORR) is the main phenomenon occurring in mixed ionic and electronic conductors (MIECs) used as air electrodes in solid oxide cells.
Titulo: Identifiability of the mechanisms governing the reaction kinetics of MIEC electrodes in solid oxide cells

Sentencas: Their optimisation requires the identification of the ORR regime, which is typically performed via electrochemical impedance spectroscopy (EIS).
Titulo: Identifiability of the mechanisms governing the reaction kinetics of MIEC electrodes in solid oxide cells

Sentencas: In this study we present a physics-based model to simulate the impedance spectra of p-type oxygen-deficient perovskite MIEC materials.
Titulo: Identifiability of the mechanisms governing the reaction kinetics of MIEC electrodes in solid oxide cells

Sentencas: The EIS response of four extreme kinetic scenarios, characterised by the rate-determining step (electron-transfer or ion-transfer) and the high/low surface coverage of adsorbed oxygen, is mechanistically interpreted for both dense films and porous electrodes.
Titulo: Identifiability of the mechanisms governing the reaction kinetics of MIEC electrodes in solid oxide cells

Sentencas: A strategy for kinetic identification is proposed based on distinctive EIS fingerprints at different oxygen partial pressures (pO2) and cathodic bias.
Titulo: Identifiability of the mechanisms governing the reaction kinetics of MIEC electrodes in solid oxide cells

Sentencas: However, distinguishing the kinetic scenarios is not free from ambiguity even in dense films since some scenarios are discriminated only via a quantitative analysis, which may be susceptible to experimental errors in real measurements, and reverse behaviours appear when combining cathodic bias with pO2 variation.
Titulo: Identifiability of the mechanisms governing the reaction kinetics of MIEC electrodes in solid oxide cells

Sentencas: More difficulties arise in porous electrodes since bulk oxygen vacancy transport interacts with the ORR response.
Titulo: Identifiability of the mechanisms governing the reaction kinetics of MIEC electrodes in solid oxide cells

Sentencas: Application of the proposed strategy using literature data for some common MIEC materials shows the typical challenges of kinetic identification when relying solely on EIS.
Titulo: Identifiability of the mechanisms governing the reaction kinetics of MIEC electrodes in solid oxide cells
